Overview

The goal of this week is to explore implicit bias, understand a little bit about the psychology behind it, and realize the negative impact that implicit bias has in developing an inclusive and diverse organization.

Learning Objectives

By the end of this module, you should be able to:

  • Define implicit bias
  • Identify different forms of biases
  • Understand how implicit bias interrupts equity and inclusion
  • Explore strategies to disrupt implicit bias

Action Items

Activities & Assignments

  1. Explore the Implicit Association Test (IAT) at the Project Implicit site at Harvard University
    https://implicit.harvard.edu/implicit/
  2. Watch the video on Implicit Bias at the Ethics Unwrapped site at U. of Texas
    https://ethicsunwrapped.utexas.edu/video/implicit-bias
  3. Read Keith Payne, Laura Niemi, John M. Doris. How to Think about ‚ÄòImplicit Bias‚Äô. March 27, 2018
    https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-to-think-about-implicit-bias/
  4. Participate in the Discussion forum.
  5. From the Additional Resources, read an extra article or watch one of the videos.
